page.title: 09Leckford Church
page.content: {The church}is the only part of Leckford not owned by the John Lewis Partnership.It is in the centre of the village and is surrounded by a churchyard.It is supervised by the vicar of Longstock.{Communion services are held every{Sunday}and{evensong}on alternate weeks. The{nave}dates from the 13th century and the{chancel}from the 16th.There are seats for about 60 people,mostly in{pews with doors,}and 12 beautifully carved{choir stalls which originally came from an Italian Monastery. There are{five bells}in a new bell turret.Three of these are from the 16th century and two modern ones. There is a{stained glass window above the{stone altar,}a carved 16th wooden{pulpit}and a Norman{font.
